title_sort: william h. millis, jr. to walt whitman, 20 january 1868
title: William H. Millis, Jr. to Walt Whitman, 20 January 1868
text: Bridgevill[Bridgeville] DelJan 20th 1868Dear UncleI take this oppertuneity[opportunity] of giveing[giving] you this as an excuse for not comeing[coming] up to see you again before Leveing[leaving] the city. on the same evening I was taken with a very severe Chill[chill] and the morning I was so sick that I could not think of staying in the city an hour longer. I come home and have been sick every[ever] since. My arm has come out in a sore were[where] one of the balls struck it it is so bad that it gives me much pain that I cantcan't rest but the Dr thinks it will be well again soon Father is very sick at this time.Uncle if I were to send you an aplication[application] for a position in the Interior[Interior] Department with recommendation will you please put them in for me and see the Asst.Assistant Secretary & urge him to give me a posison[position] I have some recomdation[recommendation] from Curtain of Pa & my Captain. I will stop with the hope of hearing from you soon.Sister wishes to be remembered to youYour Humble ServantWm H. Millis Jr. William H. Millis, Jr. to Walt Whitman, 20 January 1868
